docs.abstract: Is unauthorized immigration as much of a problem for the U.S. as some claim?

docs.lead_paragraph: The finding contradicts critics’ predictions that pre-exposure prophylaxis, or PrEP, would lead to less condom use and more H.I.V. infections.

headline.main: Insurer Says Clients on Daily Pill Have Stayed H.I.V.-Free
headline.print_headline: Insurer Says Clients on a Daily Pill Have Stayed Free of H.I.V. for Two Years

docs.abstract: Study published by Kaiser Permanente, San Francisco's largest private health insurer, in journal Clinical Infectious Diseases finds that not one of 657 clients given pre-exposure prophylaxis became infected with HIV over period of more than two years; subjects were given two-drug combination called Truvada; findings contradict concerns of critics, who said PrEP could lead to more HIV infections.
docs.snippet: The finding contradicts critics’ predictions that pre-exposure prophylaxis, or PrEP, would lead to less condom use and more H.I.V. infections.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly 900,000 military veterans have officially pending applications for health care from the Department of Veterans Affairs, the department's inspector general said Wednesday, but "serious" problems with enrollment data make it impossible to determine how many veterans were actively seeking VA health care.

headline.main: Watchdog: 900,000 Vets May Have Pending Health Care Requests
headline.print_headline: Watchdog: 900,000 Vets May Have Pending Health Care Requests

docs.lead_paragraph: Two Minnesota lawmakers accused of making out in a car at a regional park say a park ranger made up the story.

headline.main: Lawmakers Deny They Were Making Out in Car at Minnesota Park
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Deny They Were Making Out in Car at Minnesota Park

docs.lead_paragraph: A lawsuit challenging the ride-hailing service’s designation of drivers as contract workers, not employees, will be heard as a class action.

headline.main: Uber Rebuffed by Judge in Ruling on Drivers’ Suit
headline.print_headline: Judge Rebuffs Uber in Ruling on Drivers

docs.abstract: Federal Judge Edward M Chen awards class-action status to suit filed against Uber raising questions about whether its drivers should be considered contract workers; case hits at heart of Uber's business model, which keeps operating costs low by classifying drivers as contract workers.
docs.snippet: A lawsuit challenging the ride-hailing service’s designation of drivers as contract workers, not employees, will be heard as a class action.

docs.lead_paragraph: The state has a large poor and unhealthy population, with high rates of unintended pregnancies, a shortage of health professionals and too few who will accept Medicaid, as Planned Parenthood does.

headline.main: Louisiana Lays Bare Difficulty in Push to Cut Planned Parenthood Funding
headline.print_headline: Fears About Push to Cut Planned Parenthood

docs.abstract: Fear is welling in Louisiana over Gov Bobby Jindal's efforts to cut funding for state's two Planned Parenthood clinics; medical workers say large number of undeserved people in state have no other option for sexually transmitted disease treatments.
docs.snippet: The state has a large poor and unhealthy population, with high rates of unintended pregnancies, a shortage of health professionals and too few who will accept Medicaid, as Planned Parenthood does.

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House on Tuesday praised the decision by Alaska Gov. Bill Walker to expand Medicaid to thousands of residents over the wishes of the Republican-led Legislature, calling it the "right decision."

headline.main: White House: Alaska's Medicaid Expansion 'Right Decision'
headline.print_headline: White House: Alaska's Medicaid Expansion 'Right Decision'

docs.snippet: The White House on Tuesday praised the decision by Alaska Gov. Bill Walker to expand Medicaid to thousands of residents over the wishes of the Republican-led Legislature, calling it the "right decision."

docs.lead_paragraph: The last major piece of President Barack Obama's health care law could raise costs for thrifty consumers as well as large corporations and union members when it takes effect in 2018.
